name: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald

name: Moby-Dick
description: A novel by Herman Melville about Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A classic novel by Harper Lee about racial injustice in the Deep South.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A coming-of-age novel by J.D. Salinger, centered around Holden Caulfield.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel by Jane Austen about love and social class.

name: Tuesdays with Morrie
description: Tuesdays with Morrie: An Old Man, A Young Man and Life's Greatest Lesson i

name: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fuck
description: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fuck: A Counterintuitive Approach to Living a Good Life

name: The Odyssey
description: The story follows a hero, Odysseus, the king of Ithaca, who is trying to return home to his family after fighting in the Trojan War.

name: Everything Is F*cked
description: This book shows us how we can live a better life in unconventional ways through a journey uncovering radical truths

name: Atomic Habits by James Clear
description: A practical guide on how to build good habits and break bad ones using proven psychology and small changes that make a big difference over time.

name: The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical story about a young shepherd named Santiago who travels in search of a worldly treasure but discovers a deeper personal journey instead.

name: Rich Dad Poor Dad
description: A classic on financial education and wealth-building, sharing lessons the author learned from two father figures in his life.

name: The Aeneid
description: The most famous Roman epic, telling the story of Aeneas, a Trojan hero who escapes the fall of Troy and travels to Italy, where he becomes the ancestor of the Romans. A blend of war, love, loss, and divine intervention.The most famous Roman epic, telling the story of Aeneas, a Trojan hero who escapes the fall of Troy and travels to Italy, where he becomes the ancestor of the Romans. A blend of war, love, loss, and divine intervention.

name: On the Nature of Things (De Rerum Natura)
description: A philosophical poem that combines science, nature, and the universe with poetic beauty. It presents Epicurean thought in an epic form.A philosophical poem that combines science, nature, and the universe with poetic beauty. It presents Epicurean thought in an epic form.

name: Beowulf (Old English Epic)
description: A heroic tale of a warrior fighting monsters like Grendel and a dragon. Full of bravery, loyalty, and fate.

name: Moby-Dick
description: A novel by Herman Melville about Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge against the white whale.

name: The Midnight Library
description: This novel follows Nora Seed as she explores alternate versions of her life in a library between life and death.

name: Where the Crawdads Sing
description: A mystery novel set in the marshes of North Carolina, centered around the mysterious Kya Clark.

name: Educated
description: Tara Westover’s memoir about growing up in a strict, survivalist family and eventually earning a PhD from Cambridge.
A dystopian novel by George Orwell that explores themes of totalitarianism, government surveillance, and personal freedom.

name: Atomic Habits
description: James Clear’s self-help book outlining how small changes in habits can lead to big improvements in life.

name: The Alchemist
description: A philosophical novel by Paulo Coelho about Santiago’s journey to find his personal legend and treasure.

name: The Silent Patient
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who stops speaking after shooting her husband, and a psychologist’s quest to understand why

name: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
description: Yuval Noah Harari’s exploration of human history, from the rise of Homo sapiens to present-day issues and future possibilities.

name: The Book Thief
description: Set during World War II, it follows Liesel, a girl who steals books to share them in Nazi Germany.
